TITLE: Basic Database Connection and Query
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to establish a basic connection to PlanetScale database and execute a query using TypeScript.
SOURCE: https://github.com/planetscale/database-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { connect } from '@planetscale/database'

const config = {
  host: '<host>',
  username: '<user>',
  password: '<password>'
}

const conn = connect(config)
const results = await conn.execute('select 1 from dual where 1=?', [1])
console.log(results)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Database Transaction Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement database transactions with automatic rollback on errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/planetscale/database-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { connect } from '@planetscale/database'

const config = {
  host: '<host>',
  username: '<user>',
  password: '<password>'
}

const conn = connect(config)
const results = await conn.transaction(async (tx) => {
  const whenBranch = await tx.execute('INSERT INTO branches (database_id, name) VALUES (?, ?)', [42, "planetscale"])
  const whenCounter = await tx.execute('INSERT INTO slotted_counters(record_type, record_id, slot, count) VALUES (?, ?, RAND() * 100, 1) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE count = count + 1', ['branch_count', 42])
  return [whenBranch, whenCounter]
})
console.log(results)
```

TITLE: Installing PlanetScale Database Driver
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the PlanetScale database package via npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/planetscale/database-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm install @planetscale/database
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Database URL Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure the database connection using a URL string instead of separate credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/planetscale/database-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { connect } from '@planetscale/database'

const config = {
  url: process.env['DATABASE_URL'] || 'mysql://user:pass@host'
}

const conn = connect(config)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Connection Factory Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using the Client connection factory class for creating fresh connections per transaction.
SOURCE: https://github.com/planetscale/database-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { Client } from '@planetscale/database'

const client = new Client({
  host: '<host>',
  username: '<user>',
  password: '<password>'
})

const conn = client.connection()
const results = await conn.execute('select 1 from dual')
console.log(results)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Query Parameter Formatting
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using different query parameter formats and custom formatting implementation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/planetscale/database-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const results1 = await conn.execute('select 1 from dual where 1=?', [42])
const results2 = await conn.execute('select 1 from dual where 1=:id', { id: 42 })
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { connect } from '@planetscale/database'
import SqlString from 'sqlstring'

const config = {
  format: SqlString.format,
  host: '<host>',
  username: '<user>',
  password: '<password>'
}

const conn = connect(config)
const results = await conn.execute('select 1 from dual where 1=?', [42])
console.log(results)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Custom Type Casting
DESCRIPTION: Examples of implementing custom type casting functions for specific data types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/planetscale/database-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { connect, cast } from '@planetscale/database'

function inflate(field, value) {
  if (field.type === 'INT64' || field.type === 'UINT64') {
    return BigInt(value)
  }
  return cast(field, value)
}

const config = {
  cast: inflate,
  host: '<host>',
  username: '<user>',
  password: '<password>'
}

const conn = connect(config)
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const result = await conn.execute(
  'SELECT userId, SUM(balance) AS balance FROM UserBalanceItem GROUP BY userId',
  {},
  {
    cast: (field, value) => {
      if (field.name === 'balance') {
        return BigInt(value)
      }
      return cast(field, value)
    }
  }
)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Row Return Value Formatting
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify return value format as objects or arrays.
SOURCE: https://github.com/planetscale/database-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const query = 'select 1 as one, 2 as two where 1=?'
const objects = conn.execute(query, [1], { as: 'object' })
// objects.rows => [{one: '1', two: '2'}]

const arrays = conn.execute(query, [1], { as: 'array' })
// arrays.rows => [['1', '2']]
```

TITLE: Custom Fetch Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Examples of implementing custom fetch functions using undici and fetch-h2 for older Node.js versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/planetscale/database-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { connect } from '@planetscale/database'
import { fetch } from 'undici'

const config = {
  fetch,
  host: '<host>',
  username: '<user>',
  password: '<password>'
}

const conn = connect(config)
const results = await conn.execute('select 1 from dual')
console.log(results)
```

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { connect } from '@planetscale/database'
import { context } from 'fetch-h2'
const { fetch, disconnectAll } = context()

const config = {
  fetch,
  host: '<host>',
  username: '<user>',
  password: '<password>'
}

const conn = connect(config)
const results = await conn.execute('select 1 from dual')
console.log(results)
await disconnectAll()
```
